review: I had high hopes for this, but it hasn't been useful at all. Now it's just hanging uselessly on the back of the TV while we use the old Apple TV instead. It turned out that almost everything we wanted to do with this involved using ChromeCast to cast from computer or phone to the stick... but there was always trouble with poor performance, stuttering, yuck. Basically, it easily extinguished its own use. And the Apple TV still does fine, even when we use AirPlay (the equivalent of "casting").  Not sure why this doesn't work well, there's no reason it shouldn't compete equally with the Apple TV.

review: This thing rules. First thing, I have a Smart TV (specifically a first-gen Sony GoogleTV) and I prefer using a Chromecast versus all the smart features my TV has built in. It's just plain faster and easier to use. I have mine plugged straight into my A/V receiver so I get both audio and video directly from the Chromecast and the video pushed to the TV while the receiver does the audio. There's an abundance of chromecast apps available that will stream just about anything you want. This thing is the perfect entertainment streaming device.
